item.title: $C^*$-algebras associated to directed graphs of groups, and models of Kirchberg algebras
item.description: arXiv:2403.02849v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We introduce $C^*$-algebras associated to directed graphs of groups. In particular, we associate a combinatorial $C^*$-algebra to each row-finite directed graph of groups with no sources, and show that this $C^*$-algebra is Morita equivalent to the crossed product coming from the corresponding group action on the boundary of a directed tree. Finally, we show that these $C^*$-algebras (and their Morita equivalent crossed products) contain the class of stable UCT Kirchberg algebras.
item.dc:creator: Victor Wu

item.title: Characterization of ($\alpha$,$\alpha$)-derivation on $B(X)$
item.description: arXiv:2403.02815v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Let $X$ be a Banach algebra and $B(X)$ be the set of all bounded linear operators on $X$. Suppose that $\alpha: B(X) \rightarrow B(X)$ is an automorphism. We say that a mapping $\delta$ from $B(X)$ into itself is derivable at $G \in B(X)$ if $\delta(G) = \alpha(A)\delta(B) + \delta(A)\alpha(B)$ for all $A, B \in B(X)$ with $AB = G$. We say that an element $G \in B(X)$ is an $(\alpha,\alpha)$-all derivable point of $B(X)$ if every $(\alpha,\alpha)$-derivable mapping $\delta$ at G is an $(\alpha,\alpha)$-derivation. In this paper, we show that every $(\alpha,\alpha)$-derivable mapping at a nonzero element in $B(X)$ is an $(\alpha,\alpha)$-derivation.
item.dc:creator: Quanyuan Chen, Yaqi Li
